intro: Spiesia altaica, commonly known as the Altai spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Altai Mountains region. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cold, dry environments. It features showy yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are simple, alternate, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
